Wright, Frank Lloyd (American architect, 1867-1959) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: An example of Wright's design of standardized “system-built” homes now known as the “American System-Built Homes.” Built on speculation by developer Arthur L. Richards. This bungalow design was the most widely built of all of the American System-Built Homes. -- https://www.findingmrwright.com/residential/1916-1919/richards-bungalow/ [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
